result.execSummary:
The defendant Duane Lashon Madge Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Duane Lashon Madge Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Duane Lashon Madge Jr. was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Duane Lashon Madge Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Duane Lashon Madge Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court for Ct 2. Court waives costs on Cts 3 and 4.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Duane Lashon Madge Jr. in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Duane Lashon Madge Jr.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Cts 2, 3, and 4 and State will move to dismiss Cts 1 and 5. State will recommend the following: Ct 3- WSPS 2 years (1 in and 1 out); Ct 2- guideline penalties; and Ct 4- 6 months jail. State recommends that all incarceration periods are concurrent to each other. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court dismisses Cts 1 and 5. State heard. Attorney Richards heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders the following: Ct 2: 6 months jail, $2577, 36 months DL revocation, alcohol assessment, and 24 month IID; Ct 3: 6 months jail, Ct 4: 6 months jail. All periods of incarceration are concurrent to each other. Court costs to be paid within 1 year of being release from confinement for Ct 2. Court costs waives on all other counts. 9 days credit granted.

Defendant Duane Lashon Madge Jr. in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.
